summary: The Saving Our Interconnected Lives Act (SOIL Act) amends the Food Security Act of 1985 to promote practices that benefit both soil and wildlife habitat. The bill increases payments to producers under the Environmental Quality Incentives Program (EQIP) and the Conservation Stewardship Program (CSP) for practices addressing both soil and wildlife habitat resource concerns. It specifies criteria for payment eligibility and evaluation of applications, emphasizing projects that improve habitat and increase carbon sequestration.
